data.title: Sangeeta Sudha
data.text:
P gOpanandana valaripu nuta pada

sArasa mAramaNa pAhi || Oh son of Nanda, Devendra worships your lotus feet. You are the husband of Goddess Lakshmi. A.P. tApasagEya keertE bhava

tApavimOchana moortE

divya hEma makuTAdi virAjita

padmanAbha madhusudana jaya jaya || Sages sing your glory. You dispel worldly afflictions. You are majestic with divine golden crown. Oh Padmanabha, Oh Madhusudana, victory to you. C 1 pAta phalguNa harE kari

parama gamAmarapAlana ruchipada

sAmajAdhipa bhayahara paTucharita

peetavasana vilasita mrugamada

vAtanandana lalita padayuga

neeti sAgara yadukulavara bhava

khEda nASana nava jaladhara sama || You dispelled Arjuna's troubles. Your gait is majestic. You protect Devatas. You dispelled Gajendra's fear. You are glorious. You shine in yellow silk robes. Kasturi Tilaka is beautiful on your forehead. Anjaneya the son of wind-god comforts your feet. You are embodiment of morals. You are jewel of Yadu dynasty. You dispel worldly sorrows. You shine like water-bearing cloud. C 2 pApa neerada pavana sadaya niga

mAdruta mAmava SArada

sArasAyata sudaLanayana yugaLa

roopa nindita manasija mruduhAsa

gOpAlaka nutana chAru ka

lAparAjita pAlaya vidhu kula

deepa gata mada mAnasa mOhana || You dispel sins like the wind shatters clouds. You are merciful. You are comprehended by the Vedas. Your eyes are beautiful like lotus petals in Sarat Rutu (Autumn). You excel Manmadha in beauty. Your smile is gentle. You are protector of cows. You are the beacon light of Chandra dynasty. You remain in the hearts of egoless. You are enchanting.

/ End of song //>
